summary: This document is a series of emails from August 2019 between FBI personnel and others coordinating the logistics and planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James (LSJ). It details preparations for personnel, lodging, transportation, and equipment, and references the prior search of Epstein's NYC residence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The target of the investigation; the planned search is for his private island, Little St. James. His NYC residence was previously searched.

events.title: Planned search of Little St. James Island
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting an affidavit for a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's private island, with plans to have it sworn out and executed.

events.title: Initial planning for island search
events.description: FBI New York initiates coordination for a planned search of Epstein's island, anticipating it within the next 30 days.

events.title: Search of Epstein's NYC residence
events.description: Referenced as a prior event where a warrant for pictures and proof of residency at Epstein's NYC home led to immediate observation of items providing probable cause for a full 13-hour search yielding 845 pictures.

keyFacts: The FBI and SDNY were actively planning a full search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, in early August 2019.
A prior search of Epstein's NYC residence initially had a limited warrant but expanded to a full 13-hour search after investigators immediately observed items giving them probable cause.
Logistical challenges for the island search included securing lodging on hurricane-impacted St. Thomas, coordinating boat transport via CBP, and preparing for extreme heat and humidity.

The email chain indicates a desire to execute the island search quickly to avoid the 'circus' nature of the case, referencing a past investigation from '12 years ago' that SDNY preferred to isolate from.
Multiple names and email addresses are redacted in the document, indicating coordination between various FBI personnel, AUSAs, and other law enforcement partners like CBP and USCG.
